document_title: Orchitis: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
1. Subject
Orchitis can happen to anyone of any age. However, the disease often occurs in 3 main groups of people including: (3)
Boys from 10 to 19 years old: At this age, boys have a high risk of getting mumps. This leads to an increased risk of orchitis in children; Men who are sexually active: This is an activity that increases the risk of transmitting infections, including orchitis; Men over 45 years old
2. Risk factors increase the risk of disease
People at high risk of orchitis are  people who are suffering from mumps. Boys aged 10 - 19 years old and those who have not been vaccinated against mumps have a high chance of contracting mumps and developing orchitis.
On the other hand, orchitis is also a disease caused by infection. Therefore, people whose activities are prone to urinary tract infections are also at high risk of orchitis.
Activities and factors that increase the likelihood of orchitis in men include:
Having sex without using protection; Have a history of sexually transmitted diseases STDs; People who have had or are inserting catheters or other medical devices into the penis; People with congenital diseases of the urinary system, usually the bladder or urethra structures
